core.replay_buffer

core.replay_buffer#

The replay_buffer module contains various buffer types.

Buffers follow a common interface defined in ReplayBuffer. Actual implementations contain the HERBuffer as well as a default MemoryBuffer without special sampling.

The TrajectoryBuffer is not a replay buffer, but holds experience from an episode of fixed time length. It is a convenience class for storing experience in an orderly fashion during training.

class mp_rl.core.replay_buffer.ReplayBuffer#

Abstract base class for replay buffers.

abstract sample(*_)#

Abstract sample method.

abstract append(*_)#

Abstract append method.

class mp_rl.core.replay_buffer.TrajectoryBuffer(size_s: int, size_a: int, size_g: int, T: int)#

Trajectory buffer to hold a single trajectory of fixed time horizon from a single episode.

append(*args: Tuple[numpy.ndarray])#

Append experience to the buffer.

If the buffer is not full, args is a tuple of 4 arrays: state, action, goal, achieved goal. If the buffer is full, one additional observation tuple of 2 arrays state and achieved goal should be appended.

Parameters

args – Experience samples. Either state, action, goal, achieved goal arrays, or only state and achieved goal array.

Raises

  • AssertionError – Trajectory append arguments don’t match the current state of the buffer.

  • IndexError – Append call after buffer has been filled.

clear()#

Clear the buffer arrays.

keys() → collections.abc.KeysView#

Expose the key method of the internal buffer.

Returns

A key view of the buffer

values() → collections.abc.ValuesView#

Expose the values method of the internal buffer.

Returns

A values view of the buffer

items() → collections.abc.ItemsView#

Expose the items method of the internal buffer.

Returns

An items view of the buffer

class mp_rl.core.replay_buffer.HERBuffer(size_s: int, size_a: int, size_g: int, T: int, k: int, max_samples: int, reward_fun: Callable, sample_mode: str = 'her')#

Hindsight Experience Replay Buffer class.

Buffer expects episodes of fixed time horizon T.

append(ep_buffer: mp_rl.core.replay_buffer.TrajectoryBuffer)#

Append experience in a trajectory buffer to the replay buffer.

Parameters

ep_buffer – Trajectory buffer filled with replay experience.

sample(batch_size: int) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray]#

Sample a batch from the replay buffer.

Parameters

batch_size – Batch size

Returns

The sampled batch.

Raises

RuntimeError – Sample mode is not supported.

get_trajectory_buffer() → mp_rl.core.replay_buffer.TrajectoryBuffer#

Create a trajectory buffer of appropriate dimensions for this HERBuffer.

Returns

The trajectory buffer.

mp_rl.core.replay_buffer.her_sampling(states: numpy.ndarray, actions: numpy.ndarray, goals: numpy.ndarray, agoals: numpy.ndarray, batch_size: int, p_her: float, reward_fun: Callable) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray]#

Sample a batch at random with HER goal resampling from replay experience.

Parameters

  • states – State batch array.

  • actions – Action batch array.

  • goals – Goal batch array.

  • agoals – Achieved goals batch array.

  • batch_size – Batch size.

  • p_her – Probability of resampling a goal with an achieved goal.

  • reward_fun – Reward function of the environment to recalculate the rewards.

Returns

A tuple of the sampled state, action, reward, next_state, goal batch.

Raises

Assertion error – Dimension check on states failed.

mp_rl.core.replay_buffer.default_sampling(states: numpy.ndarray, actions: numpy.ndarray, goals: numpy.ndarray, agoals: numpy.ndarray, batch_size: int, reward_fun: Callable) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray]#

Sample a batch at random without goal changes from replay experience.

Parameters

  • states – State batch array.

  • actions – Action batch array.

  • goals – Goal batch array.

  • agoals – Achieved goals batch array.

  • batch_size – Batch size.

  • reward_fun – Reward function of the environment to recalculate the rewards.

Returns

A tuple of the sampled state, action, reward, next_state, goal batch.

Raises

Assertion error – Dimension check on states failed.

class mp_rl.core.replay_buffer.MemoryBuffer(maxlen: int = 10000)#

A simple ReplayBuffer that stores single replay experience samples.

append(exp: Tuple[numpy.ndarray, Union[int, numpy.ndarray], float, numpy.ndarray, bool])#

Append an experience sample to the buffer.

Parameters

exp – An experience sample consisting of state, action, reward, next_state and done.

sample(batch_size: int) → List[numpy.ndarray]#

Sample a batch of replay experience from the buffer.

Parameters

batch_size – Batch size.

Returns

An array of state, action, reward, next_state and done arrays.

Raises

AssertionError – Buffer contains less samples than the requested batch size.

clear()#

Clear the buffer from previous experience.
